note.p: Solicitor. Son of William Robson Scott, principal of the West of England Institution for the Education of the Deaf and Dumb. Practised in London, 1871–82, Bradford, Yorkshire, 1883–1905, and Ilkley, Yorkshire, 1890–1905. Retired to Bromley, Kent, by 1911.
Census returns of England and Wales 1911 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG14/3633/72)
Correspondence vol. 23, letter from W. H. Scott, 13 November 1875
England & Wales, national probate calendar (index of wills and administrations), 1858–1966 (Ancestry.com, accessed 18 February 2015)
